text:
<@U01GDKHFCV6> I think we might need to update the example command in the readme. At one point, `env.account 123` worked, but it looks like the proper syntax is `--env account=123` so the final command might look something like:
  `webpack --watch --env account=123 --env autoupload`
Yeah, that’s what i’m using from <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/webpack-cms-plugins|this documentation>.  The full error looks like this, below. I appreciate you looking at this

For context this is the functionality we’re talking about <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/vs-code-extension-hubl-linting-in-public-beta?hs_preview=XAnFUZzP-49358590790|HubL linting in the VS Code extension>
what if it was only active if a HubSpot.config.yml file could be dedected?

Great question <@U3T21PDBK>.  I have a follow up for you.

knowing that the file needs to be set to HTML+HubL or CSS+HubL. *Do you feel that we should also be checking for the config file?*

That would mean you would need your files set to the + HubL version in addition to us also detecting the HubSpot config file.

ohhhh so you’re saying that we will still have to
1. manually set the lang to `html + hubl|css`  and then 
2. have it automatically lint
???
 Sorry, I thought you were saying the hubl extension would lint any file (meaning we wouldn’t have to set the language – which gets super annoying on every file btw.)

Good afternoon community, I have a question.

I want to create a drop down list app using data from a custom object (CAMPAÑA), where I made some end point to filter and search such vehicles.  (attached image)

Is it possible to implement this interface? I want to place it on a web page and it will be used only by HubSpot account users.

Any suggestions please.

Right now yes you would still need to manually set that language.

We do know it’s an inconvenience to have to set the language. It’s currently the easiest way for us to add language specific functionality such as highlighting and auto completion and linting.

If you have other ideas of how we could detect HubL more dynamically in the .html file type without doing this, we’d definitely be interested in hearing.
